physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Shoulder length hair with moderate bitemporal recession, positive hair pull test with telogen hairs over the entire scalp. Iron studies, serum zinc, thyroid function tests, free androgen index, and dihydroepiandostendione levels normal; antinuclear antibody negative.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: No reduction in daily hair shedding over 18 months; biopsy consistent with CTE in 1997. Continued hair shedding reported at 150 hairs per day and 400 while shampooing in 1998; no visible reduction in hair density. By 1999, continued shedding with positive hair pull test; no miniaturization noted in biopsy. On reviews from 2000-2003, shedding continued at 50-150 hairs per day; no reduction in hair density despite ongoing shedding.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: 450 hairs collected in a single day of diffuse hair shedding; history of hyperthyroidism, treated with radioactive iodine; low T4 and elevated thyrotropin upon initial assessment.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Six months later, no improvement and continued shedding up to 400 hairs per day; repeated biopsy consistent with CTE. Continued shedding reported at 4 and 8 years, with no loss in hair volume.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Chronic diffuse hair shedding, reduction in the volume of ponytail, and bitemporal recession without widening of the central part; thyroid function tests normal.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-ups showed continued hair shedding fluctuating between 50 and 300 hairs per day over 8 years; no decrease in follicle T:V.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Increased hair shedding, loss of ponytail volume, bitemporal recession; normal thyroid functions, iron studies, and hormone parameters.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Fluctuating hair shedding between 50 and 300 hairs per day with consistent scalp biopsy results showing no decrease in follicle T:V over 8 years.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Generalized hair shedding coinciding with Hashimoto's thyroiditis and iron deficiency; positive hair pull test and full head of hair appearance.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: 12 months later, hair loss progressed with widening of the central part; diagnosis of androgenetic alopecia made after biopsy changes.
